CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 13, 1954, pg. 21, reads: "Jackie Robinson - Bats for Brotherhood - Jackie Robinson, 1954 chairman of the Commission on Community Organizations of the National Conference of Christians and Jews, is undertaking a nation-wide tour building interest in Brotherhood Week, to be celebrated Feb. 21-28. He was in Pittsburgh Monday.  Other stops include Detroit, South Bend, St. Louis, Tulsa and Los Angeles.  Louis A. Radelat, director of the commission, accompanied Jackie. For Broadcast - Teamwork, and the acceptance of men on ability was a recurring theme for the day.  Tape-recording a broadcast with Johnny Boyer, Jackie praised Branch Rickey, who overrode pleas of his doctor and family not to endanger his health, and possibly risk his life, in strain of paving the way for Jackie to end jim crow in organized baseball."
TitMainTitle: Johnny Boyer interviewing Jackie Robinson at table with microphone
